The company reported soft Q1 earnings and lowered its FY25 guidance, leading to a 30% drop in its stock price.
The company engaged Conduit Capital to provide structural internal support and assistance with capital-raising activities, leading to a 50% surge in its stock price.

The company announced updated interim data including up to 24 months of follow-up data from 29 treated patients enrolled in the ongoing U.S. and European Phase I/II clinical trials of AMT-130 for the treatment of Huntington's disease, leading to a 47% surge in its stock price.
The company announced a 1-for-20 reverse stock split effective July 11, 2024, leading to a 16% drop in its stock price.
